From 2010 to 2020, fossil fuel companies have donated millions of dollars to fund climate research across Ivy League institutions.

Of the reported schools, Princeton University received the largest total of donations at $36,096,163 from five different fossil fuel companies.

Brown

$4,175,980

Each circle represents the donation made by each company.

 

The larger the circle, the greater the total donation.

 

Company Donor

Princeton

Shell

$11,022,164

$6,233,634

BP

Chevron

$25,969,385

Koch

$9,458,744

Harvard

ExxonMobil

$3,212,139

Conoco

Columbia

Columbia has received a total of $5,509,450 from six different fossil fuel companies.

Note: Of the eight Ivy League institutions, only four are recorded in the sourced data.

Source: Data For Progress; Data as of Sept. 27, 2023

Graphic by Trinity Suma
